thread.title: Giants' Beckham not practicing; game-day decision
thread.title_full: Giants' Beckham not practicing; game-day decision

author: Matt Breen,
title: Giants' Beckham not practicing; game-day decision
text:
EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. - New York Giants wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr. said Thursday that he will not know whether he can play Monday night against the Eagles until the day of the game.
Beckham, who has not practiced this week, said his hamstring injury was a "day-by-day" thing. He said he would use the extra day of rest created by the Monday game to his advantage.
"Treatments, treatments, treatments," Beckham said. "Just make sure you stay on top of it. That's really it. Just make sure you stay on top of it all and come out for Monday."
Beckham injured the hamstring late in Sunday's win over San Francisco. He denied that it happened on his touchdown dance. Beckham has 31 catches this season for 428 yards and three TDs. If healthy, Beckham will provide a stiff test for a defense that has struggled against the pass.

Latest NFL odds SHOP: Eagles Training Camp sportswear Who will win the Giants-Eagles game on Monday night? Eagles. Giants. View results The electric wide receiver caught 14 passes for 213 yards and a touchdown in two games against the Eagles last season. Philadelphia fans treated him last season "like royalty," Beckham said.
"If you can't get your blood pumping for that, I don't know why you're really here," Beckham said. "It's just one of those games. Giants vs. Philly."
